TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ViewInfo

Docs.summary: This type is a wrapper for a COM interface implemented by a coclass that is required by managed code for COM interoperability. To access the members specified by this interface, use the type that wraps the coclass that implements this interface. For information about that type, including usage, remarks, and examples, see.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsDefault { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IsDefault : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the view is defined as the default view in a Microsoft InfoPath form.

remarks.para: The IsDefault property of the object can be used to determine whether a view is the default view, and it can be used to programmatically change the default view before the first view is loaded.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.

example.para: In the following example, the IsDefault property is used to make the second view contained in the collection the default view:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Name As String
public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the view that is associated with the object.

remarks.para: The name of the ViewInfoObject object is the same as the name of the view that it represents. The name of the ViewInfoObject object can also be used as the argument to the property of the collection.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.

example.para: In the following example, the Name property of the object is used to display the name of a view in a message box:
